definitions.definition: the ability to do something successfully or efficiently.
examples: the players displayed varying degrees of competence

definitions.definition: the legal authority of a court or other body to deal with a particular matter.
examples: the court's competence has been accepted
synonyms: scope "matters within the competence of the courts"

definitions.definition: the ability of a criminal defendant to stand trial, as gauged by their mental ability to understand the proceedings and to assist defense lawyers.
a speaker's subconscious, intuitive knowledge of the rules of their language.
effective performance of the normal function.
examples: adequacy, appropriateness, suitability, fitness; Moreeffectiveness; formalefficacy "the competence of the system"Moreeffectiveness; efficacy the competence of the system

definitions.definition: an income large enough to live on, typically unearned.
examples: he found himself with an ample competence and no obligations
